selected_quotes: Evidence for methane in Martian meteorites - research and @westernuEarth
Ahhh one for all of us with bits of Mars in our collection - @geoffnotkin @Jane_MacArthur @msgmeteorites
Methane in Martian crust could be an energy source for life. #WesternU on a team who are now scratching the surface.

citation.abstract: The putative occurrence of methane in the Martian atmosphere has had a major influence on the exploration of Mars, especially by the implication of active biology. The occurrence has not been borne out by measurements of atmosphere by the MSL rover Curiosity but, as on Earth, methane on Mars is most likely in the subsurface of the crust. Serpentinization of olivine-bearing rocks, to yield hydrogen that may further react with carbon-bearing species, has been widely invoked as a source of methane on Mars, but this possibility has not hitherto been tested. Here we show that some Martian meteorites, representing basic igneous rocks, liberate a methane-rich volatile component on crushing. The occurrence of methane in Martian rock samples adds strong weight to models whereby any life on Mars is/was likely to be resident in a subsurface habitat, where methane could be a source of energy and carbon for microbial activity.
citation.title: Evidence for methane in Martian meteorites

news.title: Du méthane dans les météorites martiennes
news.summary: Des chercheurs ont broyé des météorites martiennes retrouvées sur Terre pour analyser les gaz qu'elles contenaient. Il y ont découvert du méthane, qui peut être produit par une activité...

news.title: Scientists Find Methane in Mars Meteorites
news.summary: Scientists have discovered traces of methane in Martian meteorites, a possible clue in the search for life on the Red Planet.

news.title: Methan in Marsgestein gefunden: Mögliche Energiequelle für Leben
news.summary: Gibt es Leben auf dem Mars? Diese Frage beschäftigt Forscher schon lange. Nun zeigt eine Studie, dass Methan im Marsboden vorkommt. Dies könnte mikrobielles Leben auf dem Planeten ermöglichen oder zumindest einmal ermöglicht haben.

news.title: Methane in Mars Meteorite Hints as Possibility of Life on the Red Planet
news.summary: A team of researchers have discovered traces of methane in Martian meteorites. The new findings could be a huge clue in the hunt for life on the Red Planet.

news.title: Methane in Mars meteorites = life?
news.summary: Biological processes can produce methane. Its presence in Martian meteorites might mean Mars was or is habitable for microbial life. Or it might not.

news.title: Methan im Mars-Gestein: Eine mögliche Energiequelle für Mikroben
news.summary: In Meteoriten vom Mars haben Forscher Methan nachgewiesen. Das Gas könnte eine Lebensgrundlage für Mikroben im Untergrund sein – wenn es sie denn gibt oder gab.

news.title: Methane found in meteorites from Mars
news.summary: Methane stored in Martian meteorites points to possibly habitable environments beneath the surface of the Red Planet.

news.title: Scientists Discover Evidence of Methane in Martian Meteorites

news.title: Планетологи обнаружили метан внутри метеоритов с Марса
news.summary: Геологи онбаружили в марсианских метеоритах большое число молекул метана, которые указывают на то, что в недрах красной планеты постоянно образуется метан, и что его почвы являются более благоприятными для "глубинной" подземной жизни, чем мы считали ранее.

news.title: Methane In Mars Meteorites Another Hint At Red Planet's Potential For Life
news.summary: Scientists have another clue that may point to the present or past existence of life on Mars. A team of researchers from around the globe have found traces of the gas methane trapped within a Martian meteorite.
